snippet: The earthquake on Saturday in California exposed a fault line previously considered inactive and proved a perfect test for the United States  Geological Survey's new quake data network, geologists said today.    The 7.0-magnitude quake, which stru...
lead_paragraph: The earthquake on Saturday in California exposed a fault line previously considered inactive and proved a perfect test for the United States Geological Survey's new quake data network, geologists said today. The 7.0-magnitude quake, which struck at 2:46 A.M. Saturday near Ludlow, about 100 miles east of Los Angeles, caused minor injuries and light damage.
abstract: Earthquake in California on October 16 revealed fault line previously considered inactive and was perfect test for US Geological Survey's new quake data network (S)

headline.main: California Quake Reveals an Active Fault
